sub_title: Transformation Lead Tech and Customer Services @ APG
summary:
I am driven by an endless curiosity and desire to create new things and to make an impact. I love challenges and technology and to use these as a means in realizing change. On a societal, organisational and personal level.

I get inspiration from challenges in unknown territory, to keep extending the boundaries of my comfort zone. I greatly enjoy acting as a guide to create a path together with others.

During all my journeys I have seen many innovations come to life. I like to look at challenges from a variety of perspectives to select a well-considered, effective plan of attack.

I believe we are capable of creating our own future. Dare to dream and realize it!

profile_positions.description: Part of transformation team that is responsible for creating the vision and execution for next level customer servicing. Focus on Product Management, Technical Product Management and Transformation and Change.
profile_positions.title: Transformation Lead Tech and Customer Services @ Customer Experience | Marketing & Proposition

profile_positions.description:
Member of the leadership team of innovation. CTO/CIO role for all innovations. Responsible to ensure innovations can and will go into production. Driver to setup a flexible and scalable platform. Foundational to enable AI operationalization. Bridge function between development, run and business development. Sparring partner to formulate key strategic goals and to translate these into technology needs. Research and implement new technologies and support departments to use technology profitably.

The innovation department focuses on innovating on the core strategic challenges of APG. I have to make sure we can move beyond the experimental and proof and concept phase to ensure successful innovations will go live.
profile_positions.title: Data and Implementation Lead

profile_positions.description: The AI Hub Brightlands is one of the 7 national hubs that are part of the NLAIC (The Netherlands AI Coalition). In name of APG I am part of the program team that sets and oversees execution of the strategic business plan. My responsibility is to accelerate the valorisation of startups and scale-ups in the  Limburg region.
profile_positions.title: Program team - startup scale-up lead ecosysteem

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for product management, technology roadmap and community management at Kandoor.nl, a Dutch start-up with the mission to make financial knowledge available to everyone, for free.

As a subsidiary of APG, Kandoor faces the challenge to become a successful venture over the coming years. Since Kandoor uses a unique combination of AI with a community of volunteers to answer financial questions, the charitable nature serves as a compass for future directions.

Kandoor has a highly innovative nature. We are focusing on delivering a new model to support pension funds and administrators on reaching and activating people for pension awareness through our platform. Also, Kandoor is a front runner on experimenting with Voice technology.
profile_positions.title: CTO

profile_positions.description:
Built data science capability from the ground up inside the business intelligence department of APG. Centralized all data scientists, built the team. Made new hires and was HR responsible for the team for almost 2 years. Grew the team to 11 data scientists. Organized a data science education curriculum. I was part of the leadership team to lead an agile transformation for about 70 people. The agile model is based on Spotify but we customized it to have a better fit in the organizational environment. Our transformation has resulted in the birth of a new business unit named Data Intelligence (DI).

In addition to the leadership challenges I designed the main business model for data science; “Smart Connectors”, which are customized API’s that take data as input and can be integrated in frontend and administrative systems to improve efficiency or enable new functionalities. The data science environment was built on top of the centralized data hub, Data Core. Being a scalable system that minimizes the time from a pilot solution to a productionized data science solution, resulting in fully governed smart connectors.

On the application part, the first two years were focused on innovative applications and pilot projects to deliver business value. A backlog of several successful pilots were ready to deliver continuous value. The bottleneck at the time was the fully governed data part, since the demand far exceeded the supply.

The first 1.5 years, this role held a broad responsibility with many major decisions to take. Once DI went live, the role became more narrow and facilitating towards the business. This did not fit my own profile and strengths well. Therefore, I supported the new lead in taking over the data science team and helped him merge it with the data analytics team.
profile_positions.title: Lead Data Scientist

profile_positions.description:
Six sigma innovation consultant for R&D departments of the top 30 Dutch multinationals. 
Main responsibilities were acquisition, relationship management, project management and project execution. Acquired and executed dozens of projects with a varying workload from a few days up to several years. See below for a selection of the most prominent projects. 

Philips / JDE / etc. – 2015 / 2016
Created a new business model together with a colleague to perform competitor analyses based on online reviews and ratings. 

Philips Consumer Lifestyle – 2015 / 2016
Supported the main engineering lead to help realize the production process of the Philips OneBlade. The key challenge was to “marry” the production process of a supplier with their own production process. For this purpose a complex custom made network of mathematical models to model KPIs had to be constructed and simulated to identify issues and optimise the production chain. 

Philips Lighting - 2010 until 2016
In partnership with Philips founded reliability methodology and simulation software for all led based systems. Modeled all important failure mechanisms, product characteristics and usage conditions. The third generation of the software was developed in C# and has hundreds of users worldwide. Developers are obliged to use the software to guarantee quality of all products decades into the future to prevent high costs for potential claims. 

DE Master Blenders 1753: 2013 - 2015
Black belt support in an international project to reduce customer complaints. Project scope was end-to-end from raw materials to user experience. Results were phenomenal in improved quality and reduced complaints to a stable all-time low. As a by-catch, the project financed itself through cost savings on first time right production settings. The increased knowledge level enabled future fundamental optimisations in the production chain, while maintaining the high level of performance for all KPIs.
profile_positions.title: Senior Consultant Product and Process Innovation

profile_positions.description:
AgroEnergy: 2014/2015
Project that won the first Dutch data science price in 2017, the Hendrik Lorentz Price. The energy generation for growers was optimised using an automated solution that maximises energy revenues while fulfilling heating demands. I supported on maintaining and adjusting the pilot solution in Microsoft Access and VBA until the production solution was ready with a combination of a data warehouse, C++, R and the COIN solver. 

Santa's Challenge Kaggle: 2015
Together with some colleagues I participated in the FIGO Christmas challenge on Kaggle. We finished 4th out of 1127 teams worldwide. For this big data optimisation challenge we used a parallelized simulated annealing algorithm in C++. The trick of the trade was in the neighbouring space by performing a relative huge number of swaps and excluding as many irrelevant locations as possible.
profile_positions.title: Consultant Product and Process Innovation

profile_positions.description:
Philips Lighting: 2011/2012
Initiator and technical lead for the Golden Lamps project. During another project we stumbled upon a serendipity that had the potential of saving millions annually. With great enthusiasm we investigated the discovered phenomenon. At the second stage gate the project was killed despite fantastic progress. However, a potential solution was still too far away to increase the chances of success to an acceptable rate for further investment. 

Corus – 2008/2009
First data science project in SAS. Using the DMAIC framework we built data driven KPIs to monitor and improve steel coil surface defects. Dozens of databases on customer complaints, production and inspection data had to be combined, filtered and aggregated. The results were explainable KPIs on quality inspection data, usable for production steering, with a strong predictive power towards steel coil quality.
profile_positions.title: Junior Consultant Product and Process Improvement
